titles.title: To repeal the unearned income Medicare contribution provision in the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010.
To repeal the unearned income Medicare contribution provision in the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Amends the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010 to repeal the unearned income Medicare contribution provision, under which: (1) net investment income (interest, dividends, annuities, royalties, rents, passive income, and net gain from the disposition of nonbusiness property) is included in the Medicare taxable base; (2) a 3.8% tax is imposed on it, beginning in 2013; and (3) the net investment income of taxpayers with adjusted gross incomes of under $200,000 ($250,000 for joint returns) is excluded from such tax.
